Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw plants that have plenty of water and light and are healthy and growing.
The student can draw plants that do not have enough water and show signs of wilting or poor growth.
The student can draw plants that do not have enough light and show signs of weak or stunted growth.
The student can show through their drawings that all living plants need both water and light to survive.
The student can illustrate, using patterns in their drawings, the differences between plants with adequate water and light and plants without.
